availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac N. Noe (Clark County, Illinois, student and soldier (11th KY Cav USA))

body.p: Clark County, Illinois, student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James T. Noe and Nancy J. Furguson Noe. Resident of Grant County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attended school in Clark County, Illinois, in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private and corporal from September 22, 1862 to July 14, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 357B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Clark County, Cumberland, p. 79.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0110.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Grant County Marriages, Film 001490815.
"Isaac N. Noe (1845-1924)," Find A Grave, Memorial 17247774, accessed September 15, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17247774.
